metadata.title: CVE-2021-4209 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in GnuTLS. As Nettle's hash update functions internally call memcpy, providing zero-length input may cause undefined behavior. This flaw leads to a denial of service after authentication in rare circumstances.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4209` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.7.6-2ubuntu1
guile-gnutls - 3.7.6-2ubuntu1
libgnutls-dane0 - 3.7.6-2ubuntu1
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.7.6-2ubuntu1
libgnutls30 - 3.7.6-2ubuntu1
libgnutlsxx30 - 3.7.6-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.7.6-2ubuntu1').
